net.sf.jclec.mo.strategy

Class OMOPSO

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclec.mo.strategy.MOStrategy
      • net.sf.jclec.mo.strategy.MOPSOStrategy
        • net.sf.jclec.mo.strategy.OMOPSO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, net.sf.jclec.IConfigure, net.sf.jclec.JCLEC
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConstrainedOMOPSO, SMPSO

    public class OMOPSO
extends MOPSOStrategy
    OMOPSO strategy.

    The OMOPSO strategy considers a fixed-size archive of external solutions and the use of two mutation operators to have a balance between explotation and exploration. The e-dominance principle and the crowding distance proposed by NSGA-II are used to discard solutions if the number of non-dominated solutions exceeds the archive size.

    Paper: M. Reyes-Sierra, C.A. Coello Coello, “Improving PSO-based Multi-Objective Optimization using Crowding, Mutation and e-dominance". Evolutionary Multi-Criterion Optimization, vol. 3410 LNCS, pp. 505-519, 2005.

    HISTORY:

    • (AR|JRR|SV, 1.0, March 2018) First release.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Aurora Ramirez (AR), Jose Raul Romero (JRR), Sebastian Ventura (SV)

    Knowledge Discovery and Intelligent Systems (KDIS) Research Group: http://www.uco.es/grupos/kdis

    See Also:
    MOPSOStrategy, Serialized Form

      • initialize

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> initialize(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> swarm)
        Initialize the needed variables after the initialization of the algorithm. The initial archive will be created (if it is required) using the initial swarm.

        In OMOPSO, the archive is created considering the set of non-dominated solutions within the initial population. To decide whether a solution should be added or not, the e-dominance and the crowding distance are computed by invoking the fitness assignment method.

        Specified by:
        initialize in class MOPSOStrategy
        Parameters:
        swarm - Particles in the current swarm.
        Returns:
        The initial archive of solutions.

        public void createSolutionComparator(java.util.Comparator<net.sf.jclec.IFitness>[] components)
        Create the solution comparator.

        OMOPSO uses e-dominance.

        Specified by:
        createSolutionComparator in class MOPSOStrategy
        Parameters:
        components - The set of simple comparators for each objective.

      • configure

        public void configure(org.apache.commons.configuration.Configuration settings)

        Specific parameters for OMOPSO are:

        • uniform-mutator: IMutator (complex)

          The uniform mutator to be applied.

        • non-uniform-mutator: IMutator (complex)

          The non-uniform mutator to be applied.

        • archive-size: (integer)

          The maximum archive size.

        • epsilon-values (List):

          List of epsilon values to define the landscape partition (one for each objective function configure). If only one value is set, then it will be applied to all the objectives.

        • number-of-hypercubes (integer):

          Number of hypercubes. Default value is 10. This element is only used if the list of epsilon values is not provided.

        Specified by:
        configure in interface net.sf.jclec.IConfigure
        Overrides:
        configure in class MOStrategy

      • matingSelection

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> matingSelection(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> swarm,
                                                                java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> archive)
        Select particles that will act as leaders.

        In OMOPSO, leaders are selected from the archive performing a binary tournament based on the crowding value.

        Specified by:
        matingSelection in class MOPSOStrategy
        Parameters:
        swarm - Particles within the current swarm.
        archive - Individuals belonging to the external archive.
        Returns:
        List of selected individuals (leaders).

      • environmentalSelection

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> environmentalSelection(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> swarm,
                                                                       java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> disturbedSwarm,
                                                                       java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> archive)
        Select survivors for the next generation.

        In OMOPSO, the swarm is completely replaced by the disturbed swarm.

        Specified by:
        environmentalSelection in class MOPSOStrategy
        Parameters:
        swarm - Particles within the current swarm.
        disturbedSwarm - Particles created by variation operators.
        archive - Particles belonging to the current archive.
        Returns:
        List of survivors.

      • updateArchive

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> updateArchive(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> swarm,
                                                              java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> disturbedSwarm,
                                                              java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> archive)
        Update the archive of solutions.

        In OMOPSO, non-dominated solutions are included in the archive (using the e-dominance). If the archive exceeds the maximum size, it is reduced considering the crowding value.

        Specified by:
        updateArchive in class MOPSOStrategy
        Parameters:
        swarm - Particles within the current swarm.
        disturbedSwarm - Particles created by variation operators.
        archive - Particles belonging to the current archive.
        Returns:
        List containing the new member of the archive.

      • updateVelocities

        public void updateVelocities(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> swarm,
                             java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> leaders)
        Update the velocities of the particles within the swarm.

        OMOPSO proposes its own mechanism to update the velocities, fixing the bounds for the random weights.

        Specified by:
        updateVelocities in class MOPSOStrategy
        Parameters:
        swarm - The swarm.
        leaders - The leaders.

      • updatePositions

        public void updatePositions(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> swarm)
        Update the positions of the particles within the swarm.

        After updating the positions using the new velocities, OMOPSO checks if the new positions exceed the bounds.

        Specified by:
        updatePositions in class MOPSOStrategy
        Parameters:
        swarm - The swarm.

      • turbulence

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> turbulence(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> swarm)
        Apply a turbulence mechanism within the swarm.

        In OMOPSO, the swarm is divided into three parts. The uniform mutation is applied to the first one, whilst the non-uniform mutation is applied to the second one. The third partition is not mutated.

        Specified by:
        turbulence in class MOPSOStrategy
        Parameters:
        swarm - The swarm.
